p: Together, both reactions provide for a hydrogen release of 7.9 wt.%. The third dehydrogenation step, i.e., the LiH decomposition is beyond any practical hydrogen storage operational temperature. Ball milling and the use of additives have reduced the dehydrogenation temperature of LiAlH 4 [ 72]. The list is extensive among the additives. However, the use of Ti-salts, TiCl 3Â·1/3AlCl 3, [ 73], or NbF 5 [ 74] stands out. Data on apparent activation energies indicate an effective reduction of this parameter upon the use of additives [ 74]. Blanchard et al. proposed a reduction or elimination of an induction period (slow production rate of Al or Li 3AlD 6 nuclei) during the decomposition of LiAlD 4 as the action mode of the additives [ 75].
